posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Here is room for cheese. If you go rogue 13/ monk 1 you can keep ED early if you are satisfied with a late monk level and only maxing the monk skills.
Taking away a paladin level costs an epic feat, but what you gain is probably better than armor skin, espscialy if you have wis items/buffs. But then again you also have to compare with what you get when going with a shield, even if this is a dual wielder.
A monk level will give a 20% xp penalty.
Once you go monk, you get 6 attacks per round with a single kama, 7 with flurry. Then perhaps you want to rethink the whole dual-wield setup. Maybe you even end up with an elf build for dual-wielding kamas.

Nah, the build is fine as is, just if you want a liittle cheddar in there, after you take your 13th level of Rogue and the Epic Dodge you can finish at 37th-40th level with a single Monk level to get the extra goodies. No reason to change those daggers in there, pretty sweet dual-wielder and with high AB as well, i think it will do just fine for anyone want a high AC - high AB dual-wielder. Overall a solid build, well done sir.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
With favored class none, you will have a problem with xp penalty once you start combining base classes (here rogue and paladin). Levelling will be harder when you also add the ECL penalty.
Regular halfling has +2 dex and -2 str. None of the races give better dex. You can get more from other stats and maybe be able to shuffle things around so you can start with a dex 19, without gimping everything else. It will not improve the build sigificantly though, and is probably not worth the XP and ECL penalties.
